abstract.p: Brazil's Varig Airlines will spend $100 million to expand its cargo unit into logistics company that will include distribution, delivery, packaging and storage services; new company, to be called Varig Logistica, is expected to account for 30 percent of Varig's revenue, or about $500 million this year; company is expected to compete with FedEx and DHL, which have stepped up investments in Latin America in recent years (S)

block.p: Varig, Brazil's leading airline, said yesterday that it would spend $100 million expand its cargo unit into a logistics company that will include distribution, delivery, packaging and storage services. The new company, to be called Varig Logistica, or Varilog for short, is expected to account for 30 percent of Varig's revenue, or about $500 million this year. The company is expected to compete with FedEx and DHL, which have stepped up investments in Latin America in recent years.
